intro: Chaetogastra triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its small, white or greenish flowers are usually clustered in triplets, giving it its common name. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
